intro: Antirrhinum rytidospermum, commonly known as the golden snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular with two lips, a feature common in the Scrophulariaceae family. Antirrhinum rytidospermum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
